meanings.definition: A thin piece of cord, twine, or similar material used for tying, binding, or hanging things.
meanings.sent1: She used strings to tie the balloons to the chair.
meanings.sent2: The strings on the kite were colorful and long.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the strings on the curtains were perfect for playing.
meanings.sent4: The strings of fate seemed to pull them together.
meanings.sent5: The strings of the guitar hummed with each pluck.

meanings.definition: A series of items or events connected or related in some way.
meanings.sent1: The strings of events led to an unexpected outcome.
meanings.sent2: The strings of clues helped solve the mystery.
meanings.sent3: The strings of coincidences made her believe in fate.
meanings.sent4: The strings of history intertwined to create a rich tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The strings of stories wove together seamlessly.

meanings.definition: A set of musical instruments played by plucking, strumming, or bowing the strings.
meanings.sent1: The strings of the violin produced a melodious sound.
meanings.sent2: The strings of the harp resonated through the hall.
meanings.sent3: The strings of the guitar seemed to dance under his fingers.
meanings.sent4: The strings of the cello sang a melancholic tune.
meanings.sent5: The strings of the orchestra harmonized beautifully.

meanings.definition: A group of characters or symbols treated as a single unit in programming or data processing.
meanings.sent1: The strings of code controlled the program's functions.
meanings.sent2: The strings of data were organized into meaningful information.
meanings.sent3: The strings of commands executed the desired actions.
meanings.sent4: The strings of text formed a coherent paragraph.
meanings.sent5: The strings of variables stored important values.
